register.reg_condition: when AArch32 is supported and FEAT_PMUv3 is implemented

purpose_text.para: Holds event counter n, which counts events, where n is 0 to 30.

field_description.para: Event counter n. Value of event counter n, where n is the number of this register and is a number from 0 to 30.
If is implemented, the event counter is 64 bits and only the least-significant part of the event counter is accessible in AArch32 state:

content.para: Reads from PMEVCNTR<n> return bits [31:0] of the counter.
Writes to PMEVCNTR<n> update bits [31:0] and leave bits [63:32] unchanged.
There is no means to access bits [63:32] directly from AArch32 state.
If the implementation does not support AArch64, bits [63:32] are not required to be implemented.

field_description.para: If is not implemented, the event counter is 32 bits.

access_permission_text.para: PMEVCNTR<n> can also be accessed by using PMXEVCNTR with PMSELR.SEL set to n.
If is implemented and <n> is greater than or equal to the number of accessible event counters, then the behavior of permitted reads and writes of PMEVCNTR<n> is as follows:

listitem.content: If <n> is an unimplemented event counter, the access is UNDEFINED.
Otherwise, the access is trapped to EL2.

access_permission_text.para: If is not implemented and <n> is greater than or equal to the number of accessible event counters, then reads and writes of PMEVCNTR<n> are CONSTRAINED UNPREDICTABLE, and the following behaviors are permitted:

listitem.content: Accesses to the register are UNDEFINED.
Accesses to the register behave as RAZ/WI.
Accesses to the register execute as a NOP.
Accesses to the register behave as if <n> is an UNKNOWN value less-than-or-equal-to the index of the highest accessible event counter.
If EL2 is implemented and enabled in the current Security state, and <n> is less than the number of implemented event counters, accesses from EL1 or permitted accesses from EL0 are trapped to EL2.

access_permission_text.para: PMEVCNTR<n> reads-as-zero and ignores writes if all of the following are true:
PMEVCNTR<n> ignores writes if all of the following are true:

note.para: In EL0, an access is permitted if it is enabled by PMUSERENR.{ER,EN} or PMUSERENR_EL0.{UEN,ER,EN}.
If EL2 is implemented and enabled in the current Security state, at EL0 and EL1:

listitem.content: If EL2 is using AArch32, HDCR.HPMN identifies the number of accessible event counters.
If EL2 is using AArch64, MDCR_EL2.HPMN identifies the number of accessible event counters.

note.para: Otherwise, the number of accessible event counters is the number of implemented event counters. For more information, see HDCR.HPMN and MDCR_EL2.HPMN.

ps.name: MRC
MCR
